articles.title: Computational modeling of frequency-dependent neocortical response to thalamic neurostimulation in epilepsy
articles.description: Author summary Focal cortical dysplasia is a malformation of cortical development. It is a common cause of drug-resistant epilepsy, characterized by recurrent seizures which strongly impact the patients’ quality of life. In these patients, exploratory stereo-…
articles.content:
1. Introduction
The centromedian nucleus (CMN) is an intralaminar nucleus of the thalamus, with reciprocal connections to premotor, motor, primary somatosensory and other neocortical regions. It is … [+55606 chars]
